item.description:
I hope everyone is enjoying the beautiful foliage around New England. I've been working in DC and can't wait to hit the trails back home.

It has been a while since we last played in the Middlesex Fells and I would like to return to the rock circuit. This hike will take us up and down a few hills and provide some playtime over rocky paths. This is a personal favorite, plus you don't see as many people as you do on the western side of the reservations.

The Rock Circuit
Length: 3.7 miles
time: 3 1/2 hours +/-
Difficulty: easy to moderate. While this can be very subjective I am going by my own experience and what I read online.

Plan for an easy pace with some ups and downs. There is not much in elevation change but the terrain is rocky. I strongly suggest boots or a good pair of trail shoes. Please bring enough water and snacks for you and your pups. Please remember that this time of year can get cold.

We'll meet at the Flynn Ice Rink and head out from there. Any questions please feel free to email me.

My cell number is 508-510-1136, in case you're in the area and lost.
item.name: Middlesex Fells Rock Circuit
